1.content:
Hello. My name is Mikey Shripo. I live in the state of Florida with my Mom and Sister. I were born and inch tall, and I had a decent life so far. My sister used to tease me when we were at young ages. She used to put me in places where it wasn't very pleasant, like my mom's working shoes or in her pants. Those were the rough times, but as the years went by, she got used to it, and started treating me a little more better. My mom on the other hand, was like the ultimate mother. She protected me from all sorts of things. She didn't want me to get hurt at any cost, because she thinks one badly damage can cost me my life. Once High school year got nearer, I decided to asked her a question.

***Flashback***
"Mom?"
"YES DEAR?"
"I need to get something off my chest..."
"GO AHEAD."
"Well...I think I'm able to take care of myself now."
"WELL IF YOU SAY SO, DEAR."
"Thanks mom."
***Flashback***

And it was easy as that! Although there was another problem that was troubling me. It was the high school I was going to. It was for girls only, but the brochure was too convincing to my mom, so she signed me up, and I was on my way. Still, I didn't have a great feeling about this...
1.title: Introduction

choices: EAT QUICK? I GOT TO GET YOUR TO SCHOOL EARLY."
11.content:
It was a bright and foggy morning. I have woken up from my miniature sized bed. I can see the time was...5:00?! I weren't supposed to be awake until 7:30! At the corner of my eye, I see my sister, Mella, snickering at a distance. As I turned to face her, she stuck out her tongue and started walking down the hall.
         "Ha ha ha. You think this is funny." I'm saying with sarcasm. I forget about the rude awakening, and decide to stay up. "Well, as long as I'm up, Might as well do something." I then climb down using the string you found hanging around in the house. As I'm getting down,I blow my tiny whistle to call out my friend. He was a ferret called Snout. He was incredibly trained, so I didn't worry about being eaten. Seconds later, the white furred ferret appears.
         "How you doing, boy?" I asked while scratching his chin. I then hop on to Snout's back and ride my way to the living room.

         I make it into the living room. I ask Snout to take me to the sofa, and he did as he were told. When I reached the sofa, I tell Snout to run along. Now I was on the sofa watching tv. An hour passed and I see my mom awake and heading to the kitchen to make some waffles.
         "HELLO, SWEETIE. WHY ARE YOU UP EARLY?"
         "Maybe because Mella set my alarm clock to 5:00"
         "THAT'S IMPOSSIBLE. SHE'S SLEEPING."
         "That little sneak...!" I whisper.
         "WHAT WAS THAT, DEAR?"
         "Oh nothing."
         "HMM...WELL ANYWAYS, IF YOU NEED ME, I'll BE IN THE KITCHEN."
         "Ok mom." I continued with my cartoons.

         It was 7:00, and I heard my mom calling me.
         "HONEY, COME AND GET YOUR WAFFLES." I couldn't wait for the special blueberry waffles my mother makes. I made a perilous jump off the sofa and onto the carpeted floor. I rushed into the kitchen to see my waffles hot & toasty on the dining table. I call Snout over to help me reach the table. Snout comes in a hurry and get me to the delicious waffles. Before I began stuffing your face, my mother asked me to accomplish a deed for her.
         "MIKEY, CAN YOU..."
11.title: Morning!

111.content:
"MIKEY, WOULD YOU BE SO KIND TO GET THE NEWSPAPER FOR ME?"
         "But mom, it's too heavy for me to carry it, and besides, it's foggy outside. How am I suppose to see?"
         "OH, YOU'LL THINK OF SOMETHING."
         "Ok, mom." I give my mom a pleasant smile and scurry to retrieve the newspaper. I knew for sure I couldn't do this alone, so I called Snout for assistance. My mom helped opening the door, and Me and snout were on our way.

The fog was mighty tonight, I thought. I couldn't barely see the bright toyota car my mom drives to work in. There was no color except gray and more gray. Luckily, thanks to Snout's powerful nose, He can sniff out newsprint. No less than a second, Snout picked up a scent! He ran and ran until he found something familiar.
         "Snout...that's a tree (-_-)" I was not surprised at all. Snout had a powerful nose, but it was too powerful, actually. Snout then picked up another scent. I was still not surprised.
         "Snout... that's a fire hydrant.(-_-)" I were getting irritated from all this. "Come on, Snout. Think harder. News...Paper." I saw Snout concentrating hard. Then Snout opened his eyes widely and started running.
         "Ataboy, Snout!" Then Snout stopped. Now I was going crazy. "Snout...this is the tree again!" I just came to my senses and calmed down. "Forget it. let's just go home." But Snout didn't obey this time. He was staring into the tree. "What is is, boy?" I looked up to see what was going on, and I sighted a squirrel eating some acorns. I turned to Snout, who was ready for some squirrel hunting.
         "Snout, don't go!" But Snout did anyways. He ran so fast, I went flying in the air. I landed onto something yellow & plastic. I look at the devious ferret who started chasing the Squirrel around the tree. On the other hand, I looked to see when I landed. I was astounded to see me find the newspaper! Did everything go well after that?

To avoid being squashed, I picked up the pace and hurried along under her bed. I sat quietly on the carpet, and tried to sneak into her conversation.
         "SO YOU GOING TO COME OVER?"
         ...
         "WHY? BECAUSE MY MOM'S GOING ON VACATION FOR A WEEK. I WAS THINKING ABOUT HAVE YOU AND MAY STAY TIL SHE GETS BACK."
         ...
         "MY BROTHER? DON'T WORRY ABOUT HIM. HE NOT GOING TO BE A PROBLEM. BESIDES, HE'S BEEN GONE THIS MORNING, SO YEAH."
         ...
         "WHEN SHE LEAVING? I SAY ABOUT NOW." I couldn't believe my ears! I didn't want to stay with Mella and her awful friends for a week. I was planning on convincing mom if I can join her, but I heard a faint engine staring. She must have left already! I was already depressed, but I needed to hear more of this.
         "WHAT ABOUT SNOUT? I PUT HIM OUTSIDE LIKE YOU TOLD ME TO. I KNOW YOU HATE HIM, SO HE'S NOT GOING TO BOTHER US THE WEEK." Now she put my pal out in the cold? If I was only big, I could teach her a lesson! But first I should save Snout from freezing.
         "OK, SO YOU GUYS ARE COMING AT 8, ALRIGHT?"
         ...
         "COOL! I'LL SEE YOU THEN." Then Mella hanged up the phone. Quickly, I saw her enormous foot falling from her bed, then the other pair. "I BETTER GO FRESHEN UP." She walks out of the room. Now I had two advantages. I could either get downstairs and save Snout. Also there was Mella's phone here, allowing me to cancel the party. Which one is reasonable?
11222.title: PP(Party Planning)

112221.content:
I couldn't explain how strong my bond with Snout was. We been through so much together, and he never let me down once. It was time for me to return the favor. I take one last glimpse at my devilish sister's room, before I left out into the hallway. It seemed so empty now that that mom was gone, but even when she was here, it still felt like a ghost town here with just the three of us. I ran over to the stairs. I looked down, seeing a trail that could leave me running for about two days. I didn't have any time for that. I need some wheels, and quick.
         Then something jogged my tiny memory. I run back into the room of my sister's. I look around until I find a giant trasure chest, knowing it was filled with her old toys. I climb myself up, unlocking the chest. I use all my strenght to pry to open, and then the lid popped. I jumped inside the box, looking for a certain toy. I found a couple of jacks, a sock, some marbles, but it wasn't anything I needed. I kept looking, until finally I was able to end my search. I tried my best to pull out rollerskating Barbie's roller-skate, but it seemed like she just had big feet. I gave it one last tug, and I was flying out of the box with the roller-skate in my hand. Now that I had what I needed, I was able to make it to ground level.

         I ran back out of Mella's room, with the rollerskate of her barbie in my hand. I looked back down at the stairs. Just thinking about how bad things might go makes me shiver, a lot. I position myself tightly inside the rollerskate. I begin to roll myself closer to the edge. I take one last, living breath, and then I push myself again. I shut my eyes, and feel a thump. I look back down. I only went one step. I need to fly across this thing quickly. Time was wasting. I grabbed the edge of the step once again, this time at a far distance. With a mighty pull, I take myself soaring into the living room, afraid to look down. I land with a giant thump, and see myself at the floor already.
         I look around. Mella was nowhere in sight, but that was hard for me to believe. I try to get myself out of the rollerskate, but I stuck in it real tight. I tried my best to suck in my stomach, but that didn't seem to work as well. Then I heard loud footsteps. I look toward the kitchen door, and watch Mella walk my way. She didn't look down at my puny size, and kept on walking. I was for sure she was going to crush me, but instead, she kicked my skate. I began to roll once more. I was now underneath the couch, fighting off the dust bunnies that were falling from above me. I turned my vehicle around, seeing Mella's pair of feet were heading upstairs. This was the perfect time to move to the kitchen and out the sliding glass door, where Snout what probably held captive in his little house.

         I looked both ways before I began to move. I was moving slowly, with my tired and short arms. "I need to hurry, or else Mella would find me moving." I picked up the pace just a little, and I made it inside the kitchen. I look above the counters. Mella seemed to be making some snacks for herself and her invited friends. I look across the table, able to see the sliding glass door shut and locked. I declared it was time for me to get out of the skate. With all the sweat I've collected from the little rescue so far, I was capable of getting myself out of the skate, leaving it behind out in the open.
         I ran over to the sliding door. I just needed to flip it to UNLOCK and then slide it open. I was about to start my great plan, until Mella returned, looking more refreshed than before. She must have rinsed her face before the party. I couldn't continue this if she was around. She could see me. I needed to think, and then I looked at the skate I abandoned eariler. it gave me a wicked idea. I ran back to it, and held on to the side. I pointed it straight at Mella's heel, and the pushed it at maximun speed. I hid beind a chair leg, and watch the skate go. It hit Mella real hard causing her to turn around.
         "WHAT? WHY IS MY ROLLERSKATING BARBIE'S ROLLERSKATE HERE?" She picked up the tiny skate, and walked out of the room. Now I had a little amount of time, so I worked fast. I quickly jump and climbed up the door, getting to the flip. I switch it to UNLOCK and headed toward the edge of the door. I positioned my back against the handle, and my legs on the wall. I tried all my muscles to open the door, but I only got just a few inched open, just right for my size. I slide down, and walk out into the backyard.

         The sun was setting, but I was still able to see Snout's penhouse from here. I ran into the creepy jungle of my backyard, trying to find my way through. The giant strands of green were becoming a bother, making me hope that mom would cut the grass. I traveled a long distance, feeling the mud all around my legs. I wasn't able to see my way around that accurately anymore. Now with the very dim light I was given. Eventually, it got dark, and I was blind. I heard a couple of strange noises, but I just thought they were in my head. Then I heard shuffling in the patch of grass not too far away from me. I reduced to speed-walking, trying to get away from the strange thing. The rustling got louder, and caused me to start running! I was pushing my way though the grass, not knowing where to turn or when to stop.
         Eventually, I lost my breath and stopped to retrive it. That's when the thing popped out in front of me. It was a frog, looking all slimy and green. It looked sort of pale for some reason. Without a clue of thought, it stuck its tongue out at me. It was close to catching me. It was trying to eat me for dinner! I has no intention of sticking around, so I ran as fast as my legs could take me, away from the hungry frog. I was still tired, and didn't run very far. I crawled under the mud, and hid there. I stayed quietly, until the frog hopped to my direction again. I jumped on me, with it's pair of webbed feet laying upon me. Some slime got onto me, but I maintained my cool. Eventually it left, thinking I was already long gone. I tried to get back to my feet, but the mud wouldn't let me. Then I realized I was trapped in a mini quicksand. I couldn't get out, and there was no one to assist me. I looked back over to the door, where Mella was relocking it shut. I was doomed to die in my own backyard. i didn't even have the chance to save Snout. This felt like the end once I was fully deep inside the quicksand.
112221.title: A Furry rescue.

1122211.content:
I was too afraid to open my eyes. I heard a couple of strange, unhuman voices, right above me. I was thinking that I was already living in heaven peacefully, but the language I couldn't understand.
         "Erehw did uoy dnif mih?" I couldn't make out one word these creatures were saying. I then was listening to a more female voice.
         "Eh saw tuoba ot nword ni eht tnaig elip fo dum ni eht kcab!" She sounded concerned. Was it about me?
         "Esnesnon! Yhw od uoy erac? Siht gniht si eno fo eht stnaig! Fi ew yrt ot pleh ti, ti dluow yrt ot llik su!" I wasn't very happy with that guy's tone. Not at all. I decided it was time for me to look where I was.

         When I opened my eyes, everything seemed very dark to me. A dim blue light was keeping the whole place lit. It looked like some sort of cave I was trapped in. Which only meant that I must've been rescued from that quicksand. I found myself sitting on shredded leaves. There was a tiny wooden table near my left. A couple of books were located near my right. But what really cuaght my eye was what was in front of me. Two ants, standing on two legs, looking at me with a scapel in their hands, close to performing an alien probe check on my body. I tried to see if they knew what I was saying.
         "Hello." They backed away.
         "Uoy wonk woh ot kaeps sih egauganl, ym gnuoy lipup?"
         "Sey, ris. I deiduts sih epyt kcab ni hgih loohcs." The female ant approached me, lookng confidnet then a few seconds ago. I tried my greeting again.
         "Hello."
         "Hello." Now I was the one who freaked out.
         "You know what I'm saying?"
         "Of course. Most of it."
         "Who are you? And where am I?"
         "My name is Anitak. And you, my friend, are in would you giants would call an anthill." I assumed I was in an anthill. It would explain the ants! She circled around me like a land vulture. "Hmm."
         "What? What is it?"
         She turned back to the other ant. "I t'ond kniht eh desu ot eb gib."
         "Llew, ksa mih!"
         Anitak turned back to me. "Tell me, have you always been this small?"
         "Yes. I was born like this."
         She once again talked with the other ant. "Eh saw nrob ekil taht."
         "Ti snaem erew efas! Eh t'ndluow eb elba ot ekam ti kcab emoh no sih nwo. Evig mih a ruot elihw s'eh ereh." The other ant left, leaving me alone with Anitak.          "Would you like a tour?" I was trapped in a world filled with talking and walking ants.
         "Of course. I would like it very much."
         "Oh, yeah. I almost forgot. What is your name?"
         I smiled when I answered. "Just call me Mikey. Mikey Shripo.

         We walked into the tunnels, where more ants were walking about. Some were working on the hill, and other were out scavenging for food. I had so much questions to ask Anitak, but I just didn't know where to begin. "So, Anitak, what's up with that language of yours?"
         "Oh it's very simple really. When I was in school, my teacher said that it was very similar to the giant's language, except that it was backwards."
         "Ah. So when I say 'Hello', does 'Olleh' mean the same in your language?"
         "Exactly." At least I got the language down. I could practice it a bit while I'm down here.
         "So who that guy back there earlier?"
         "Oh, him? He was my professor. He's teaching me about the arts of culture and exploration."
         "So you like exloring and things like that?"
         "Yes. I been wanting to leave this hill and move on to better places." She was like the exact opposite of me. We walked down the tunnel, and it started to appear more like a flea market.
         "Teg ruoy hserf daerb sbmurc ereh!"
         "Gnilles staoc! Gnilles staoc! Ll'yeht tcetorp uoy morf yldaed gub syarps!" You were amazed that a whole other world was just in your backyard. Anitak and I were walking, until a creep stop in out tracks.
         "Anitak! S'woh ti gniog? S'ohw siht yug?"
         "Wen yug."
         "Llew, uoy dluohs gnirb mih revo ot eht muessoloc. I tog owt stekcit. Ereh uoy og!" The guy handed Anitak two tickets, shook my hand, and went on his way.          "Who was that?"
         "Rotcev. He gave us some tickets to this cool show that happens everyday. Wanna go check it out?" I had nothing better to do.
         "Why not? Sounds like fun."

         Anitak and I were waiting in line at the colosseum. It was absolutely humungous, filled with cheering fans and a whole motherload of snacks to enjoy. When I entered, I saw the round platform that was the stage. We took our seats, and I just needed to know how this all works. "Anitak, how does this fun game work?"
         She looked at like I was some kind of moron. "Fun? This is a match for the death!" I was now a little scared, not much thrilled for the game to start.
         "What do you mean?"
         "You see Mikey, our hill is being overpopulated. So we hold these games to solve the problem."
         "Why do these ants choose to risk their lives?"
         "Oh, they don't choose. Everyone in the hill is choosen randomly. Then thoes two have to battle for their lives."
         "What happens if they lose?"
         "They are executed, of course." I was in deep shock from hearing all this. What did they mean by execution? I was so caught up with questions, the match has already started. Two scrawny ants were already starting. they were given a couple of equipment to fight with. One had a battle axe, and the other was holding wooden num-chucks. They were going about it for at least five minutes, until the num-chucks guy was getting tired. Secretly, the battle axe swung down, smacking the ant in the armor. The battle-axe guy won, leaving the num-chucks guy for excecution.

         "Esaelp! Evig em rehtona ecnahc!" whined the loser. We all watched as two buff ants dragged the loser out, and away from the colosseum.
         "What happens now?"
         "Just look." Anitak pointed towards the roof of the hill, making me realize the giant screen in the middle. I was looking around, trying to figure out how that was even possible, until I seen a couple of ants fidgiting with a cut-open wire on the ground. They used the electicity to power up their giant screen. Moments later, the screen showed a vision. It was real, pure white tiles that was shown. To them it looked like the death arena, but to me, that was the kitchen. We all looked closely to see a tiny hole in one of the tiles. The loser's head was showing through it. It looked like he was trying to resist going up, but he was pushed anyway. I saw the hole dissapear, and the loser was just walking around, looking really scared. Then three giant shadow appeared, and the stage ants maximized the volume.
         "LOOK WHAT WE GOT HERE, GIRLS." It sounded much like Mella, and that must be Layla and May, already getting themselves comfortable. "IT SEEMS LIKE WE GOT OURSELVES A TRESPASSER." The ant was trembling in fear.
         "CAN I HAVE THIS ONE, MELLA?"
         "SURE, LAYLA. IT'S ALL YOURS. SHOW IT ITS PLACE!" Seconds later, A giant foot smushed the little ant. The crowd screamed in fear, and some even cried. The screen turned off, with Layla's blue-painted toenails flexing at the camera.

         Me and Anitak were retracing our steps, back into the cave where I first awoken. We were silent the long trail there. "That was quite...disturbing."
         "Do you know them, Mikey?"
         "Who?"
         "The giants." I wanted to lie and say that they were just strangers, but Anitak need to know the turth.
         "Yeah. I know them. One of them is my sister."
         She gasped in fear. "That's terrible. Do they hurt you like they did to that ant?"
         "Yeah. But the difference is that I can't die. They can torment me all they want, and I won't go to waste."
         "That must be a horrible life."
         "Tell me about it." We made it back to the cave. The professor of her's was wide asleep. He was snorer. "Well, thanks for the tour. Bye."
         Anitak grabbed my shoulder with her cold hands. "Where are you going?"
         "I need to go back home. I can't stay here."
         "You want to go back to that torment and abuse?"
         "I'm sorry, but I just live with it. What can I do?"
         She was thinking long and hard. "Come live here."
         I was stunned. "Excuse me?"
         "You can stay here. You wouldn't be bother ant hurt as long as your here. You'll be safe." I didn't know what to say. I felt like this was a legit place, considering how nice Anitak was to me today, and a family of ants wouldn't be such a bother. But then I start to think of your other life, the one that I hated so much. How would mom think if I went missing? I give anitak my final statement of the day.
1122211.title: World of Ants.

11222112.content:
I was beginning to think how this one decision could affect my life. I wouldn't have to go to school. I didn't need to put up with Mella ever again. I would probably break my mom's heart, same goes for Snout. All was spinning in the room, memories flashing before my eyes. I couldn't concentrate well enough. I knew that if I went back now, Mella and her wretched friends would tormented me until Mom was home. It would be best if I stayed with Anitak and her professor until my mom came back home, so everything would feel sane again. I stared at Anitak. She looked at me with a concerned face, like I would leave her here. "I'll stay."
         She gasped in excitement. "Really?"
         "Yeah, but only for a little while, then I really have to go. There are just some people who would miss me if I was gone."
         "I understand. I would feel the same way if I ever left the people I cared about." We both smiled at each other, and when the Professor gave out a big snore, it showed us that it was time to sleep.
         "So...where do I sleep?"
         "Oh!" She ran towards a dark hold, resembling more like a guest room. It had a leaf twisted into a hammock, a nice wooden t.v., and a view of my house. "You can sleep in here if you want. We rarely have any visitors that often."
         "Thanks." I gave her a warm hug, and she left out of my room, confused of what that hug actually meant. I didn't have anything packed, so there wasn't much to worry about. I layed in my temporary bed, looking out the window. I could look up in the second floor window, up at Mella's room. The lights were still on, and I could see the shadows of the girls. "I hope they don't destroy the house." I face the door, shut my eyes, and fell asleep.

         I awoke from a nightmare I was having. It looked as though I had taken the place of that num-chucks ant that died yesterday. I was trembling in fear. I was looking around in the kitchen, feeling all alone. Then the three shadows appeared right behind me. The girls were in afternoon clothes, looking all happy. The scary happy.          "LOOK WHAT WE GOT HERE GIRLS!" I wasn't liking that mischievous tone of Mella very much.
         Layla closed up on me. "IT SEEMS LIKE WE GOT OURSELVES A TRESSPASSER!" I was trying to back up, but May was in the way. Layla turned to Mella. "CAN I HAVE THIS ONE, MELLA?"
         "SURE, LAYLA. IT ALL YOURS. SHOW IT ITS PLACE!" It wasn't long til Layla raised her mighty foot over me, and stomped it down.
         "No!!!"

         I was breathing quickly. I could feel myself sweating. I looked around all over the small room. I looked outside. The grass was shrouded with dew. It was morning. I climb out of the bed and walk out into the main room. The door next ot me was shut. It must have been Anitak's room. I look over at the couch. The professor was there. I wondered what I should do now. I was going to head back into my room, until I was being asked for.
         "Namuh! Evah uoy dediced ot yats htiw su?" I wasn't sure about what he was saying, but I figured a nod could fix anything. I just bowed my head, like the trainer and trainee did in thoes old Kung-fu movies, before they began training or battle.
         "Didnelps! Neht uoy dluohs evah siht." He handed me a costume. I felt heavy and hard. I tried to give him my most confused look, and he understood what I am trying to say.
         "Taht si rof gnisiugsid flesruoy morf rehto atns." I was hoping Anitak would wake up and translate for me, but that wasn't going to happen. I gave the professor some hand signals, telling him that I was going to try it on. He understood, and I went into my room to change.

         It was real difficult to put on, but I mananged to squeeze into it. I was starting to look like a real ant. Now it was time to do something else. Do I go out and explore, or do I stay and wait for Anitak?
11222112.title: The Nightmare.

112221121.content:
I figured that ants take a while of sleep before they get off to work. Actually, I didn't even know if Anitak actually worked at all. I felt bored cooped up in here. I wanted too explore more of this amazing world that was just hiding below in our back yard. I come out of my room.
         The Professor was sipping on some sort of herbal tea. "Uoy gniog tuo yadot?". I tried to understand what he was asking, but nothing came into my head. I just gave a nod. "Ecin! Dluow uoy dnim gnignirb em a nollag fo elteeb eciuj nehw uoy teg kcab?". I still have a good idea of what he said, so another nod I gave him. He continued with his herbal tea, and I continued my thorax out the door.

         Wether it was day or night, the tunnel would always stay dim. There were holes on the walls, filled with homes and familes and tons of furniture. A lady ant was watering roots near the front of her hole. Some kids were playing with a water leak, which sounds stupid because ants hate water. When they were bringing in rocks, that showed me that they were actually trying to plug it up. There were so many pathways, so many entrances and exits. I wanted to remember that path that lead to the market Anitak took me yesterday. "I knew I should've waited for her to wake up. Now I'm lost." I had no choice but to ask for directions. I need to think of how to say 'where's the market?'. I saw the lady, still watering. I gave in a deep breath, smiled a little, and walked over.
         She spotted me. "Olleh". I got nervous. I forgot what I needed to say.
         "S'erehw eht tekram?"
         "Fi uoy og otni eht driht lennut, dna ekam a tfel no eht thruof eloh, ll'uoy ekam ti ot eht tekram." I had exactly no idea what she just told me, but I just nodded in agreement. She went inside her hole, leaving me to find the path solo.

         Ignoring the wise lady's kind words, I tried to find the market my own way. Tunnel to tunnel, Hole to hole, and I still couldn't find the damn market. I was thinking of it as a one-day flea market. I didn't even have a sense of idea of how to get back to Anitak and the Professor. I sat down near the wall and bowed my head in shame, knowing it was hopeless to ever finding the market. I didn't know the life of an ant was going to be so confusing an challenging. I hear a couple of ants walking own the path. I picked and cleaned myself up, waving at them passing by. They were carrying tiny pebbles in thier hands. I wondered if that was the currency they used to buy stuff around here. I followed the group of ants, and in a matter of time, I was at the market. I mentally thanked the ants for the help, who by the way went into a store that sold giant amounts of weed. It was time to do some business.

         I was trying to figure out what the Professor wanted me to get for him. I looked around, but there was nothing I could understand. Everything was in their language, like they never had tourists or anything. Maybe he wouldn't blame me because I'm new around here. I started to search for things that intrest me. There I saw a long lenght of metal rope. I was getting tired of my silly floss rope, and that would be more stable.
         I walked over to the counter, an chatted with the owner. Since I really couldn't talk that well, I need to go back with sign language. I pointed over to the metal rope, and showed a couple of pebbles I held onto last night. He mocked me and showed the numbers: 2,0,0. It was worth 200, and all I had was 10 pebbles. I gave him the hand of 'nevermind', and he went on to his next customer. I really wanted that rope, but there was no way I could afford it. I was thinking about doing the five-finger discount, but I couldn't imagine the consequences they would put me through.
         "Eh, what could go wrong? I'm a human, and they're ants. I got the intelligence and advantage over them." The clerk has his back turned with another customer. Nobody was watching. I was quietly walking near the rope, an without giving any of this a second thought, I snatched it from the pole.
         "Yeh!" The clerk saw me with it in my tiny hands.
         "Uh-oh."
         "Ytiruces!" That was the signal for me to go.

         I couldn't find the tunnel back home, so I just ran around in circles. I had three buff ants right behind me, chasing me in furious anger. I was running into shops, ruining all the items meant to be bought. I couldn't lose them, and it felt like they were getting closer and closer. One ant tried to jump on me, but instead got dirt in its face. My legs were getting tired and eventually I was caught. The chief came up, with his cuffs on the shoulders of his suit and the star that symbolized his power. He didn't look any happy to see me. Was I in serious trouble?
112221121.title: Stroll in the tunnel.

choices: Battle of the death. Mikey vs. Anitak
1122211211.content:
I though I was a goner seeing myself in my predicament. I watched as this suited ant came close to me, shooing the security guards off of me. He grabbed my antennas and ripped them off, revealing me as a small human. The crowd gasped at my appearance, ashamed of my being. I couldn't bear to look at the glares they were giving me. They started to throw crumbs and weapons at me. I never felt so afraid of such a species less powerful. The head ant came up to me.
         "What are you doing here, human?" I was strictly amazed to see this ant able to understand some English, and fluently too.
         "You can understand me?"
         "Of course I can, you moron. I am the head ant of this colony. I must be able to understand many languages in certain situations. English was just an option in case of situations such as these. This is such a rare occurrence, it's not even surprising. So I ask again. What are you doing here, human?"
         I was too speechless to even answer him. This was too much to handle, knowing that ants are able to understand our language. This would be a huge discovery for scientists, but they would never know because the ants would be too clever to let out their intelligence. I was scared right now, hoping to get out and escape this ant hill as quick as possible. I watched this ant as he stared at me with such a devil look. I could actually feel myself facing hell and its fire pits.
         "Too bad," The ant said, "All I wanted to do was ask you a few questions, but instead, you just want to keep quiet. Might as well finish you off. Your species have pissed me off ever since I was born. You sicken me.Let's how you like being the inferior one. Sdraug!." The security grabbed me once again. "Ekat mih ot eht anera. I kniht eht rehto stna dluow ekil ot ees a namuh reffus!"
         "Stop!" Everyone halts in place, we all look into one of the entrance ways, seeing Anitak walk through with an angered look. She was asleep when I left. I bet the old guy was worried and told her where I left. I was extremely glad to see her, but kind of scared to see her like this. She didn't even take a glance at me, and stomped toward the head ant. "Release him, Joff!"
         "I'm sorry, Anitak, but I cannot do that. He is a human. Have you not seen with his kind has done to us over history. We have been crushed, abused, and even eaten by these monsters. This is a gift from the gods to plan our revenge. Why would you want to save such a disgusting species?"
         "Because he doesn't need this! He's experienced the stuff we have. He is not like the other humans. He is just like us in all ways. He doesn't deserve this kind of cruelty."
         "I know that." We were all stunned by what Joff had shared. "I know all about him. Mikey Shripo. The kid who belongs with those giantesses in that house. I've seen the things he suffered, and I am truly sorry. But he is still human. You know how our kind feels about humans. We've lost so many of our citizens because of them. I will not lift the rules because of this one kid. Now please stop refusing this."
         "No! I will not. Not until he deserves some real punishment."
         "Oh, my." Joff snapped his fingers, and some more security captured Anitak as well. "I never seen the day when an ant would go against their own kind. There's nothiong left to do but give you both punishment. I have chosen..."
1122211211.title: One Life for another.

11222112111.content:
"I Have chosen a battle to the death. You two will be each other's opponent. This will be quite an interesting battle, I assume. May this be a lesson to you, Anitak, for trying to fight the system. The fight will be hosted tonight, and I will not allow another minute to go to waste. You will be locked away until then." Then the guards walked up away into prison cells. I looked upon the crowd, seeing the ant's faces and how lowly they think of me. I look at Anitak, who couldn't even dare to take a look at anyone. I could see how she felt; being cast away from her own kind, just for saving a species that destroys her own. I didn't know that I could cause so much pain in someone's life. I ruined Anitak chance to live her life fully, and even now, I put myself in grave danger. But at least I know the death punishment is located in my kitchen, so it would only be fair to throw in the fight. I would be secured safely back into home, and Anitak would have another chance to live. I just might have found a loophole in our current situation.
         After 30 minutes of walking, Anitak and I have finally made it to the prison cells deep within the ant hill. If it was like any prison, then it would probably contain some of the more devilish bugs known to history. The guards opened the gate, and the warden was in the front desk. They pushed a bright red shell of a ladybug, and a buzzer noise sounded out. A new set of gates opened, where are the prison cells were located. Inside, I could see many kinds of bugs with a vicious look in their eyes. Spiders, crickets, praying mantises; they were all in here for a crime. We walked the path of shame until we made it into two unoccupied cells. The guards shoved us inside and left, not even taking a glance back. Now we were here alone, having to wait until our final duel. The least I could was apologize for my actions.
         "I'm sorry, Anitak. This is all my fault. I shouldn't have got caught so you would get caught yourself. I should have waited in the room until you awakened."
         "There's no need to apologize, Mikey. I have already forgiven you once I found you at the market. I just blame these rules that Joff has placed. They are unfair and cruel to all other ants. We should not fight for our freedom. We should not cast away others who do not mean harm. Joff is the main problem for all of this. You don't need to blame yourself."
         "But who is Joff?"
         "Joff is the mayor of this town. He is the most talented and intelligent person in all of the ant hill. He came to us when we were needed the most. One day, when your family decided to call an exterminator, we were all hopeless of finding peace. That's when Joff came in. He had this bizarre idea of digging a tunnel deep into the ground and waiting until the exterminator left. Fortunately, it worked, and Joff we given the title as the new mayor. Everyone was pleased with the idea."
         "Well if he was so great, then why do you hate him? And why did he make all these crappy rules?"
         "That happened five years ago. Joff got married with a woman named Guifeli. She was beautiful, but a castaway from another ant hill. Joff took her in and soon became her husband. Everyone was invited to the wedding, so everyone could see just how happy they were. They never argued, and always showed compassion to one another. Then, one day, Guifeli went missing. Joff went non-stop looking for his wife. He even convinced the professor to set up screens to find her quicker. It was a good plan, as one of the screens picked up a vision of her walking into your home. Joff couldn't hold it in him to wait and ran to fetch her. But once he got to the screen door, it was locked, and Joff could see his wife inside, picking up cookie crumbs from the floor. Then you pet came out and found Joff, ready to attack him. Joff had no choice but to run back to the hill. As he looked back, your mother came in the kitchen. Joff couldn't find Guifeli the next day. That's when he became corrupted. He got the idea of never trusting humans, no matter how big or small. He will find the power to kill any human, but for now, he's settling with you."
         I could only show a sign of sympathy for Joff. It was only right for him to get mad at my mom for what happened years ago. But this didn't involve me. I had nothing to do with the death of his wife, and neither did Anitak. We were just caught in his blind fury against humans. It is only right to try and convince him that we all don't deserve this. The guard knocked on our jail cell.
         "Ti si emit rof eht semag ot nigeb." We've been so caught up in the story that time quickly fast-forward. It was not time for one of us to leave and the other to stay. The guards grabbed us and carried us towards the arena.

         We were in the main gate, ready to enter our corners. I was scared out of my mind, but I knew that forfeiting the fight would be best for the both of us. It would have hurt to see one of my family members squish Anitak to death.
         "Mikey," I turn to hear Anitak's last words, "Whatever you do, do not give up on the fight. Fight with all your might."
         "What? Are you insane? It would be better for me to give up. I would go back home, and you would be safe. Everyone wins."
         "No, Mikey. You must honor these rules. For the sake of my pride, I would not want to win by forfeit. Think about my pride, Mikey, and how embarrassing it would be for everyone to see me win by default." I couldn't answer her because she was taking away to her side of the arena. I was forcibly taken to mind, thinking about what to do in the fight. I was going to give up the match, but for the sake of Anitak's pride, I wouldn't want her people to think she won because I told her I was gonna. The right thing to do was give the fight my best and hope she is stronger than me.
         We waited and eventually the doors opened, and the bright lights from the the crowd appeared. I saw this huge fighting space, and the yelling and applauds from the ants above us. I could easily spot Joff in the high chair, eating some bread crumbs, and sipping in some water. I looked across from me as Anitak stood motionless, and my vision was blocked as the weapons were brought up from the ground. I rushed over to them, grabbed a sword, and watched Anitak grab a dagger. Then our match to the death began. Anitak didn't take any time to hesitate and charged towards me, almost piercing my chest with a hole. I came at her with my sword with a three-combo slash, but she dodged them all. Then she made a series of slashes with her dagger, making a few minor slices on my skin. I misunderstood her; she was much more skillful than I imagined. I couldn't let my thoughts screw me over. I got back on my feet, and began to attack her once more. We were equal at strength and at will power. Neither she nor I showed any sign of giving up. We were at our last breath, staring at each other with serious looks. From the look of her eyes, she wanted to finish this with one last stab. I was hoping for the same, and suddenly charged at one another. I could never forgive Joff for making us do this. Whether I win or lose, one of us will try and stop Joff. Our contact made a collision, and dust spurred around us. Who won the match?
11222112111.title: Fight to the Finish.

112221121111.content:
The dust finally cleared away, and I could Anitak panting very deeply. She was one the ground spilling blood all over the arena floor. I worried that this kind of thing would happen. Instead of a respectable cheer, all I could hear was neglect. Food and drinks were being thrown at me. I didn't feel like a winner at all. I was nothing more that an intruder trying to fit in. I forgot the crowd and went to help Anitak. This made the audience boo even more. I tried to help Anitak, but she just kept pushing me away. I thought we were friends, but even she was embarrassed by all of this. She lost to a human, which costed her pride and dignity in this land. I felt so ashamed. This was all my fault. All I could do now was watch Joff come towards us.
         "Well, well. Looks like you actually won against her. I wouldn't be surprised. She was nothing more that a waste of time. I am very surprised, Mikey. You managed to win the duel. Congratulations." He turned to one of the guards standing next to him. "Ekat mih dna eht lrig pu ot eht tnemhsinup moor." Without any warning, I was grabbed by the arms.
         "What the hell is this Joff? I thought I won the match!"
         "Oh, you did. But your still an intruder. You were going for this anyway. At least now, you'll have a friend alongside you."
         "This isn't fair! Release Anitak! She doesn't deserve this kind of treatment."
         "Oh, but she does, Mikey. She was keeping you hidden all this time under our eyes. She is now considered a traitor." With those last words, he snaps his little ant fingers, and the guards haul us away to my kitchen for sudden death. Anitak and I were right by each other, being dragged to our final moments. I wanted to say something, but she was more traumatized on how she lost to me. She didn't deserve any of this, but still was getting punished. For now, my goal was to get back at Joff for doing this to her. I'll give him the death treatment by my own hands.
         We were following a dark tunnel. I couldn't see a thing, but the guard ants could, considering they were walking in a perfect path the whole time. I was hoping that Mella and her friends wouldn't be at home right now. I was still in this ridiculous ant costume and couldn't figure out how to get out of it. When they see me, they won't recognize me. I would be just another ant to them, ready to be squished my their giant feet. I made a grave mistake of struggling, which made the guard ants angry and knocking me on the head. Right there at that moment, I went out as a light.

         I woke up, blinded by a huge light. I look around, realizing I was back inside the kitchen. Anitak was right beside my body, trying to shake me awake. When she saw that my eyes were open wide, she was relieved.
         "Oh, Mikey! I'm so glad you're alive. I didn't want to be here all alone. Now that you woke up, you can help find a way back outside. I know your familiar with all the rooms and people, right?"
         "Of course, but you got to help me get out of this costume before I'm mistaken for an ant."
         "Of course. Right away." She came close to me and tried to get the costume off of me. She struggled with the lock, but kept on trying. As she continued, the slight smell of a familiar person was near. I couldn't tell who it was yet. I wasn't hoping for Mella to be home, but my prediction was false. The smell grew more and more musky, and soon became toxic. I couldn't breath well under this kind of air. I turned to Anitak, who I assumed lucky because she didn't have a nose. Then I could see a giant shadow cast around us.
         "OH MY GOD. MELLA, I FOUND TWO MORE!" I recognized that voice anywhere. I turned around, and saw May standing tall and beautiful. She was very sexy, but the only flaw was her extremely, terrible foot odor. I could never withstand such feet. I soon came down to my knees unable to move. I watched as Mella and her other friend, Layla, came inside the room to see what May found. Mella looked down on us, smiling so evilly. She didn't even know that I was among her vision.
         "LOOKS LIKE WE GOT SOME NEW PREY, HUH GIRLS?"
         "YOU SAID IT MELLA. I JUST WANT TO SQUISH THESE TINY CREATURES UNTIL THEIR ORGANS POP OUT!" I always figured Layla would be the most destructive out of all of them. I was scared to my wits. Anitak came close to me, not wanting to fight this alone. I couldn't help but snuggle my arms around her neck, waiting to see what will become of us.
         "SO WHAT SHOULD WE DO WITH THEM, MELLA?"
         "I THINK WE SHOULD.."
112221121111.title: Castaways.

1122211211111.content:
"WELL WE COULD JUST PLAY WITH THEM FOR A WHILE BEFORE WE KILL THEM. I JUST THOUGHT OF A PERFECT GAME. LET'S SEE HOW MUCH THEY CARE ABOUT EACH OTHER." Mella then places her hand down on the ground near us. She was pushing forward to Anitak. "COME HERE, LITTLE ANT. UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE KILLED."
         "Mikey..."
         "Trust me. You'll be fine if you go. I won't let you get killed for my mistake." She gave me a nod, and walked toward Mella's palm. Mella then quickly rose into the air and gripped her hand tightly.
         "ALL RIGHT. NOW THAT WE SETTLE THIS, LAYLA AND I WOULD GO INTO THE NEXT ROOM TO SET UP THE GAME. MAY, YOU STAY IN HERE AND KEEP THE OTHER ANT COMPANY. MAKE SURE HE DOESN'T TRY TO ESCAPE." After that was said, Mella and Layla went into the next room, while I was stuck with May. Just standing near her feet made me want to vomit. I didn't want to stand here much longer, so I try to move away. Just as I made a movement, her giant foot stomped in my path.
         "AH.AH.AH. YOUR NOT GOING ANYWHERE. I NEED TO MAKE SURE YOU DON'T GO ANYWHERE. AND THIS IS HOW I'M GOING TO DO SO." She started to raise her smelly right foot above my head. I stood in fear as it slammed down in front of my face. The disgusting cheesy scent struck my nostrils, and looking deep between her toes made me feel nauseous. She then raised her left foot. My only reaction was to walk backwards from being stomped on. I successfully extended my time from being under her sweaty, smelly feet, but she just kept going. Stomp after stomp, I found myself trapped in the kitchen corner. From here I thought I was screwed.
         "PERFECT. YOU KNEW WHAT I WAS GOING FOR." She then sat down on the floor, and spread her legs out adjacent to the walls. She now created a diamond around my perimeters, with no way of escaping. The smell of her putrid smell was contained as well, and I couldn't avoid the smell. I also was able to notice that she wasn't wearing any panties under her skirt. I was becoming aroused, but it was good that the costume acted as a barrier for my erection to extend. She just stared down at me, like I was an actual ant. Her eyes were glued down on me; wherever I paced or ran. I didn't know how long I was going to be in this situation, but I just wanted it to end.
         Ten minutes have passed, and my whole air supply has been replaced with May's foot stink. I didn't think that it would take that long to fill. My eyes were burning from the smell, and my nose was starting to burn up as well. She was just sitting there and texting on her phone. I try to walk, but the foot funk got me walking in a wobbly motion. I could control my pace, and I ending up having my head stuck in one of her wrinkles of her foot. I tugged my head out, but it was too hard. Eventually, I got my head out, which was now full of sweat and foot stink. I look back at May, who was now looking down at me. This didn't look good by the way she was smirking.
         "DO YOU LIKE MY FEET, MR. ANT?" Because of the wrong impression, she cancelled out the barrier keeping me inside. Instead, she extended her feet toward my body. I couldn't handle the stench, and try to back up some more. I realized I was still at the corner. When all seemed futile, I try to keep backing up, and she kept pushing her toes toward me. I was scared out of my mind. Between stuck between her toes would be no different than a noose around my neck. She kept inching closer and closer. "I DON'T CARE WHAT MELLA DOES TO YOU. ONCE YOUR IN BETWEEN MY SEXY TOES, YOUR MINE."
         Her toes were just inches from my face. I could see how deep the ridges in between her toes were. I would be out of plain sight. No one would be looking for me here because no one would dare go near her smelly feet. Once I enter there, I was wishing my life gone. Just as everything seemed for the worst, I could hear Mella's voice in the other room. "MAY, BRING THAT OTHER ANY IN! WE'RE READY!"
         "DAMN. YOUR LUCKY." She picked my up with her thumb and forefinger, dragging me into the air as we both enter the living room. I was amazed to see what kind of game Mella was planning. I could see all types of women's footwear all over the floor. These belonged to Mella and my mom, and probably some from Layla and May too. May set me down beside her feet, and I did the appropriate thing and ran. I watched as Mella's foot slammed in front of me.
         "LEAVING SO SOON? WE HAVEN'T EVEN EXPLAIN THE RULES YET." She then settled her big toe on top of my body as she was beginning to explain the game. "ALL RIGHT, ANT. WE HID YOUR COMPANION IN ONE OF THESE OTHER SHOES. IT'S YOUR JOB TO FIND HIM OR HER. IT DOESN'T IF YOU FIND IT OR DON'T, BECAUSE ONCE YOU FINISH, YOUR DEAD."
         She took her foot off me, and the three girls rushed over to the couch and watch. I was left the piles of shoes on the ground. It was like a junk heap with full of shoes. There were boots to the right, and flip-flops to the left. I couldn't think of where to start, but I could imagine that Anitak was scared out of her mind. I couldn't wait any longer and started to look for her. My first encounter was with a gladiator flip-flop. It smelled musty, which meant it hasn't been worn in a while. I entered the center of the shoe, trying to see if Anitak was anywhere to be found. I checked under the straps, but she wasn't anywhere. I jumped out, going for the next footwear.
         This time, I was staring into the dark, depth of a leather boot. I couldn't see a thing in there, which just gave me the sense that she might be inside there. I covered my nose from years of foot stink clogging up inside the boot, and enter for dear life. A few seconds inside, and it was like walking straight into the darkness of an abyss. I wish I had a miniature flashlight, or at the very least, a gas mask. I try to yell for her name, but all I could hear was silence. I go inside deeper, where I could start to touch the wet insole. I yell once more, but not another response. I go even deeper, down into the toe section, where the smell intensified and it was flooded with sweat. Disgusted, I screamed her name with the top of my lungs. no voice heard. I ended my venture inside a boot and kept on searching, hoping I would find her.
         After a couple more shoes, I begin to think of what to do after I find her. I was told I was going to be killed the moment I found her. We needed a way to escape without the three, troublesome girls noticed. I wish I could take off this damn costume, but I didn't know how. I needed Anitak help if I wanted to survive here. I kept looking around. There were like a dozen shoes left to check, and I couldn't tell if my nose could handle and more of these foul food odors. I almost pass out on the floor, but then it would make me think about how selfish I was being. Back in the hill, Anitak risked her own life for me. It was only fair that I would do the same for her. I got back up on my feet and entered a giant slipper.
         This was definitely my mom's right slipper. She had hers different so that she could tell her's apart more Mella's. Hers was the shade of light blue with white clouds designed on them. It smelled a little musky, knowing that my mother was just gone for a day. I could pray to gods right now, since I found Anitak taped deep in the inside. She was struggling so hard, but I managed to take her down. I pulled out her restrains from her body, and she came close for a deep hug.
         "Thank you! I was so scared that I was going to die! We're safe now!"
         "Technically, we're still in trouble. Once my sister finds out I found you, she's going to kill right on the spot. So we're stuck here."
         "Is this the end for us, Mikey? Will anyone save us."
         I thought it was the end for both of us. We were about to go out and face our death, but then and unexpected visitor opened the front door. Then was a few steps and then a small silence. Then a humongous scream occurred.
         "MELLA, WHAT IS GOING ON HERE?!" That was definitely the raging voice of my mother. "I'M GONE FOR AT LEAST A DAY, AND THIS IS WHAT HAPPENS! I WANT YOU TO PICK UP ALL THESE SHOES AND PUT THEM BACK WHERE YOU FOUND THEM! THEN I WANT YOUR FRIENDS TO GO HOME BECAUSE YOU ARE IN DEEP TROUBLE!"
         "YES, MOM!" A few seconds later, Anitak and I could feel the rumble as Mella picked up the slipper. Was she able to get us for her own risk?
1122211211111.title: Hide n' find.

11222112111111.content:
As Anitak and I believed that we were surely goners, Everything stopped as my mother began to speak.
         "MELLA WHAT DO YOU THINK YOUR GOING WITH MY SLIPPERS?"
         "BUT YOU SAID-"
         "I DON'T CARE WHAT I SAID BEFORE. I'M SAYING IT NOW. SOMETHING WENT WRONG WITH THE TICKET, SO I COULDN'T GO ON MY TRIP. THEN AS I WAS COMING BACK, MY CAR BROKE DOWN, WHICH WASTED MORE OF MY TIME. NOW I CAME BACK, FINDING MY RESPONSIBLE DAUGHTER LEAVING SO MANY SHOES LIKE SOME KIND OF HOARDER. I'M NOT IN THE MOOD, SO DROP MY SLIPPER."
         "YES, MOM..." Mella had no choice but to obey our mother, and she dropped the slipper from high up the ground. I held onto Anitak for safety, and we both landed very harshly. We look through the hole, but all we could see was the tired, sweaty feet of my mom from walking all day and last night. I could hear Mella and her friends picking up the shoes from the ground, walking out of the room without another word.
         "NOW THEN.." It wasn't long until my mom thought it would be the right time to relax. Anitak and I quivered in fear as we watch the stomping footsteps of my mother walking toward her personal slippers. She took a few seconds flexing her mammoth toes on the outside, before shoving them in. She slightly raised her left foot, slowly entering the slipper. You could see her sweaty sole dripping sweat from underneath.
         "Anitak, quick! Follow me. We have to reach the end before we're crushed underneath!"
         "Okay!" I grabbed onto her arm as we rushed over to the toe section of the slipper. My mom's foot was getting quicker and quicker, and her odor was already into our breathing zone. Luckily, we were able to avoid a painful death by reaching the toe section as planned. It was great to have some company, but it was quite frightening to realize how long we were going to be stuck in here. I stared at my mom's toes. They were like giant boulders pulled out from the bottom of the sea recently. They were soaking from the hot sun rays this afternoon. They kept flexing as my mom was very determined to find her relaxation. Every time her toes spread apart, I couldn't help but gag from the awful odor it let out. I went back to Anitak for some comfort.
         "Are you all right? I'm sorry you had to go through all this."
         "It's not you fault. It's Joff and his arrogant self. He just can't accept the fact that ants and humans could get along together. Right now, I just to go back and teach him a lesson."
         "So do I. But we got to wait a little longer. Sometimes these things happen to me, and I could say that it would be at least 30 minutes before we acutally have a chance to get out."
         "Your mom has nice feet." Anitak then gets up from our safe zone, and walks toward the french-tip nails of my mother. She admires just how well her toes were pampered and structured. Just took a few steps closer, looking deep between the toes. Since she didn't have a nose, she wouldn't have smelled any of my mother's horrible foot odor. She took a glance at the sweat droplets intact on my mother's big toe. Without any warning, she just took a big lick off a sweat droplet that was close to falling. This was going to far. I pulled her away.
         "Anitak, don't do that! It's a disgusting liquid. You don't want to drink that."
         "What are you talking about, Mikey? This taste just like the water we have back in the ant hill. It's a rich flavor. You must try it."
         "Trust me, I tried it before. Not my favorite drink." I started at her with an odd look. It was amazing to figure out that this whole situation wasn't disgusting to her as it was to me. She actually liked the taste of my mom's feet. She didn't mind getting close because she didn't have any sense of smell. She was probably thinking I was crazy because I wasn't sucking off the sweat off my mother's toes.

         30 minutes have passed, and my mom's foot was starting to shift around. She must had finished her relaxation moment and was ready to talk around again. Before we knew it, the slipper started to move, as we were being moved to some other place in the house. Stomp after stomp, I held a tight grip around Anitak, making sure she wouldn't accidently slip under my mom's colossal sole and get smashed. She kept moving and moving, until finally, she stopped. But before she took her slipper off, she dug deep inside the slipper once more. Anitak and I were in fear as we did the best to conceal ourselves deep into the slipper, hoping not to get caught. When her foot was finally out, what happened?
11222112111111.title: Maternal Toes.

112221121111112.content:
When I finally opened my eyes, I could see that my body wasn't being carried out by my mother's sweaty toes. I felt a sign of relieve until I realized what was missing. I look back, deep between my mother's toes, and I could catch a glimpse of Anitak's fragile body. I try to go after her, but the foot was already on its way somewhere else. I wanted to jump out of the slipper, but my mom quickly dropped her coat, blocking my attempt to leave by concealing the opening. I try to push away the huge coat before it was too late, but it wasn't much a success. In the shadow, I could see my mom taking off the rest of her clothing, leaving her naked. You could only think of how scared Anitak must be to my humongous mother. I pushed everything out eventually, and when I jumped out of the slipper, all I could see what my mom walking into the shower. I was too later for saving.
         My mind was already broken for what I have done to that poor ant. I got her in trouble, and because of my stupidity, she was now stuck in between my mom's giant, sweaty feet. She was probably feeling scared and alone now that we were separated. I shook my head in disgrace for the murder I have committed. In that moment, I heard a rattling sounds behind me. I took my hand, and felt the presence of that lock that held my costume. My mom's toes must've been strong enough to damage it, which was a total relief. I quickly pulled off this ant gig, and was amazed of the clothes that I was wearing before. Now all that was left was to try and save Anitak, or at least make sure that she was all right. This was my fault, so it was only right to try and save her from harm.
         I make a couple of steps from the slipper, but then stop from the noises coming from the hallway. It sounded more like Mella and her friends, and god knows she would try to bring me torture to show off to her friends. I wasn't in the mood, so I decided to hide from her in the time being. I try to look for spots beside obvious places, such as the slipper and underneath the bed. I then look upon the pocket of the coat, and gave it a chance. I crawled into one of the pockets, right before Mella showed at the door,very sly and sneaky.
         "OH, WHERE ARE YOU, LITTLE ANTS? WE'RE NOT DONE WITH OUR GAMES YET. COME OUT WHEREVER YOU ARE." She quietly entered the room alongside her friends, from what I could see through the fabric. They all split up, hoping that I would be found in a specific location. May passed by with her bare feet, and they were still strong enough to penetrate through the coat and strike my nostrils. I back up deep into the pocket, but almost lose my covering when Mella goes for the slipper. She pushed me and the coat out of the way, while she goes on and picks up my mom's slipper. She digs her hand deep inside, trying to pull out some insects, but becomes disappointed with the results.
         "DAMN! WHERE THE HELL ARE THEY?"
         "THEY MUST HAVE GOT SCARED AND RAN AWAY." May suggested. She had a point there, but wasn't close enough. We wanted to run away, but my mom's toes hindered us from leaving.
         "THIS ISN'T FAIR. IF MY MOM DIDN'T COME SO EARLY, WE COULD HAVE ENJOYED MORE OF THE FUN."
         "I WAS HOPING TO CRUSH THEM WITH MY BIG FEET! THAT WOULD HAVE MADE ME REAL HAPPY."
         "DON'T WORRY, LAYLA. YOU'LL GET YOUR CHANCE. THEY COULDN'T HAVE GOTTEN FAR. AND THERE'S NO WAY THEY COULD HAVE LEFT THE HOUSE. THIS IS A BIG HOUSE, AND THEIR JUST STUPID BUGS READY TO GET CRUSHED. TRUST ME, WE'LL FIND THEM."
         "MELLA?!" I turned my attention to the bathroom door, where my mom was standing angry and surprised. "WHAT ARE YOU DOING NOW?! CAN I JUST COME HOME WITHOUT HAVING TO DEAL WITH ANYMORE OF THIS CRAP?!"
         "BUT MOM-"
         "NO BUTS! NOW I WANT YOU TO STAY IN YOUR ROOM FOR THE REST OF THE DAY. YOUR FRIENDS CAN PACK UP THEIR THINGS AND GO HOME. NOW!" With that said, the girls all ran out of the room and did what they were told. Now that I was alone with my mother, I could try and check if Anitak was still a lone survivor. I crawl out of the pocket, and rush over to my titanic mother, who was now staring at herself in the mirror over the drawer. As I inched closer, I keep my head up that she was still in all pieces. I right behind her heel, making sure that she wouldn't see me. I'm reaching in closer and closer, until my mom make an abruptly move to take a step back. I couldn't hold in my silence.
         "Ouch!"
         "WHAT WAS THAT?" She looks down at her feet, lifts it up, only to my body flattened. "MIKEY, IS THAT YOU?"
         "Yes..." She backs up a little, picking me up with her toes, and raising me just high enough that she could use her fingers in play. I carried my limp body over to the dresser, where she fixed and tightened up my look and clothing. Apparently, like everyone else, she was mad at me too.
         "AND WHERE WERE YOU YOUNG MAN? I HAVE BEEN TRYING TO LOOK FOR YOU ALL OVER. MORE IMPORTANTLY, DID YOU GO TO YOUR NEW SCHOOL? I ASKED MELLA, AND SHE SAID SHE TOOK YOU. IS SHE RIGHT?" Through all that time talking, I just kept staring down at her feet. this view was good enough to spot Anitak. I had to get a little close. "MIKEY?"
         I snap back into reality. "Yeah?"
         "DID YOU, OR DID YOU NOT, GO TO SCHOOL?" Right now, school was the last thing on my mind. There was a lot more going on than having to worry about my education. For now, my only precaution was to make sure Anitak is safe, take her home, and try to fix that screwed up society. For now, lying would be the best excuse.
         "Yes, mom. I went. It was actually fun. I can't wait to go tomorrow."
         "THAT'S GOOD TO HEAR, MIKEY, BECAUSE I GOT SOME NEWS FOR YOU. YOUR BUS PASS CAME IN THE MAIL. NOW YOU DON'T NEED ME TO DRIVE YOU TO AND FROM SCHOOL, NOW THAT YOU CAN RIDE THE BUS."
         "Okay, mom." This couldn't have been anymore perfect. Now that I was responsible to choose my days of going to school, I can spend my time trying to save my ant friend. I needed to get myself to the floor. I gave out a fake yawn, making myself look extremely tired. "Well, I'm beat. Would you mind putting me on the floor so I can get to bed?"
         "OH, HONEY. I DON'T MIND CARRYING YOU TO BED. COME HERE." She pulled out her palm, offering me a ride back into my room. Damn it. I was really hoping to try and figure out if Anitak was all right. I didn't know it would take this long. I jump onto her palm, and quickly, she paced herself down the hall,and into my room. She pulled out my sheets, and gently tucked me in. She then puckered her lips for a goodnight kiss. "NIGHT, HONEY. SEE YOU IN THE MORNING."
         "All right, mom." She blew me a kiss and left the room. I try to lull myself to sleep, but it wasn't working. I couldn't get Anitak out of my mind, and was too worried that she might be suffering right now. I needed to know now. But I was already tucked in bed. What did I do next?
112221121111112.title: Too late.

1122211211111121.content:
I couldn't even think about sleep with the thought of Anitak petrified between my mother's toes. I had to make sure she was all right and to take her back into her own land. I couldn't possibly keep her here with all the dangers that would harm her. I knew that it was now my responsibility to clean up my mistakes and take her home. Without any hesitations, I struggled out of this tight tucking my mom gave me. I stick my hand under my bed, only to pull out a piece of glow stick. Now that I was able to see through the dark, I carefully climbed down my bed and rushed toward the door. I look both ways; noticing that the halls were very dark and scary-looking. It felt like I was going to be murdered tonight. I put my fears behind me, since there was another life on the line. I quietly crossed the hall diagonally, reaching my mother's master bedroom. From the outside, I could hear muffled snoring of my gigantic mother as she's peacefully asleep. I didn't know what would happen after this point, but I knew that I had to try no matter what. I dropped to the floor and crawled under the door, reaching the inside of my mother's bedroom.
         When I was inside, I couldn't hear any sound other than the loud snoring of my titanic caretaker. I looked at how monstrous she rolled and waved her arms as she slept. In honesty, the thing I was afraid of the most was my mother waking up and finding me around her feet. If that happened, all the excuses in the world wouldn't help me. I would be classified as a freak to my mother. Not to mention that I was up on a school night; so she might as well punish me in the process. Telling her there was an intelligent ant between her meaty toes wouldn't be enough for to believe me. I would need to show her the proof. I started to cower my way through the rough carpet, and I found myself standing near the bed. Her feet were covered by the sheets, creating a giant hill. They were enormous. I was beginning to hesitate just by the humongous size. They could flatten me in a second. With all this pressure coming towards me, I punched myself in the face. This was all about Anitak's safety, and that what I was planning to do.
         I shimmered myself under the first sheet; knowing that I would reach her feet without going around. I grabbed onto the soft fabric, and began to climb. This wasn't very hard to climb, until five minutes have passed. I soon to remember that my lack of strength was going to hinder my attempt at rescue. I wasn't even halfway there, and I already felt like letting go. I didn't bear to look down; even if I was very close to the ground. I kept trying my best to push forward, but I didn't have enough energy to continue. Every two minutes, I held on mid-air while catching my own breath. I dust particles caused me to sneeze, and I clumsily dropped my glow stick. Once it fell back down and rolled under the bed, everything went pitch black. I couldn't see where else to move but up. This was now a newly found reason to keep going. I kept struggling to pull myself up, and could imagine I was a little close. I look up high, trying to outline the structure on the bed. I could almost see the edge, which meant I was getting closer. A few more tugs, and I could whiff the faint smell of my mom's dry foot odor. Once I sniffed it out, I quickly rushed myself towards the top, and I found myself on the edge of her bed, facing the lower half of my mom's body.
         It was very hard to see anything; all that was slightly visibly was the hot pink panties she was wearing underneath her night gown. I pointed my finger toward her think legs, and traced it downward to her giant feet. I finally made it this far. I reached the place where Anitak was being held, and that I could easily take her home during the nightfall. I walked toward my mom's musky feet, only to find another problem. I felt the soft fabric of socks that she put on for warmth from the clod night. I came this far, only to have been stopped by another coating of protection. Even with the sock and the recent bath, her foot odor was still strong; which meant that her bare feet would be real stinky. The night was still young, and I didn't plan to continue this until she decided to wear nothing on her feet. There was a 50/50 chance that I would find Anitak. I would have to crawl inside her sock and check. My memory had to become fuzzy from all the hesitation and thoughts of future consequences. Which foot did I take?
1122211211111121.title: Midnight Peeking.

11222112111111212.content:
I trusted in my luck, so, I got the right foot. Ignoring the musky scent coming from my mom`s socky foot, I looked for an opening to get in. Then, I found a tiny hole near the ankle. I squirmed until I pass throuhg. "Calm down Anitak, here I go!" Now I was crawling under the cotton fibres, like a soldier on the battlefield. The smell was not so strong at that section, but I knew that when I reach the toes, things would be worse. The good thing, is that my mom was standing, maybe sleeping like a baby. Then, I reach the side of her foot and turned to the sole section, like it was finishing to climb a huge wall.
I was right, the sole section was worse. It was more smelly and musky, and I could feel the pores of her tick skin, sweating slowly. I keep crawling when I call Anitak. "Hey! Anitak? Are you there?"
But nothing answered me. I call again and nothing. Should I got the wrong foot? No! There was a hope! I crawled a bit more, throught my mom`s musky sole. The smell was terrible, but my mind was in my friend. Anitak was squashed under my mom`s big toe? Maybe between her stinky toes? No way! I was becoming afraid of that. But since Anitak was not calling me back, I assumed that at least, it was unconscious. Being trapped under my mom`s toes all day would be exhaustive. And then, finally I reached the toe section.
"Anitak?" I called once more. And since I barely could see my own hand right at my face, I decided to look for my friend, squirming between my mom`s gigantic toes. My hands was groping for Anitak, but I didin`t found anything except the flesh of the toes. I was becoming worry and desperate. Then, with a little drop of hope, I squeezed my self through my mom`s toes, but suddenly, she moved. Oh God...
I could hear a kind of moan outside as the foot moved. Quickly, I tried to move too, escaping from the grab of her toes, but was too late. They got me, pinching me. My face was burried in the arch skin, breathing all the musky scent. I was hoping that the toes release me, but no. I was permanently trapped. I couldn`t break free. I would be a long and stinky night, trapped inside my mom`s socky feet as she was sleeping in peace.
And I finally recognized that Anitak was inside the another sock. Damn...

At the morning...
11222112111111212.title: Bad Luck.

112221121112.content:
The dust finally cleared from the arena, and it was very noticeable that I was down on the ground as Anitak was still up to fight. I had no reason to give up the fight because she actually beat me. The audience began to cheer for the heroic ant, as they all throw beverages and snacks at my face. I didn't do anything because I knew it would only be as waste of time. I could see how happy Anitak was winning the fight. If she haven't, she would have been horribly humiliated and would probably be showered with ridicule and mocking. It was good to see that she won, but bad seeing Joff walking up to us competitors. He had that gleam in his eye that made me believe that he interfered with our fight. I wanted to punch him so hard in the face, but my hands were now held down by two large security men.
         "Good Job, Anitak. Never in my right mind have I ever doubted you. I knew that a mere human couldn't possibly beat us ants." He started to comes towards me, only to kick me in the face. "How does it feel, know that you have just lost to one of us? Let this just prove that we are much more superior than your kind."
         "Shut up, bastard."
         "How dare you speak to me like that!" He started to kick me some more. He aimed for the lower waist, which made things even worse. I could feel the blood spilling out my mouth with each kick. He was intentionally hitting my intestines, stopping the whole process of digestion. I couldn't believe I was taking this much crap from a lowly ant like him. He finally stopped kicking me, and finished with a spit on my face.
         "What are you going to do with me?"
         "I got an idea to what to do with you. You'll be sent back up the surface to be punished. But not to your home, knowing that it would just mean your home safe. I'll send you to one of your neighbor's for punishment. Yes...that would do nicely."
         "What?! You can't do that!"
         "Oh, but I can! Because I'm in charge. ekat mih yawa." The guards were now carrying me out of the arena, and into a dark tunnel. I could see that the audience was thrilled to see me at my doom. I saw Anitak's face, who was still crying over the fact that she won. Now that I was sentenced to death, she couldn't help but shed her tears and run out of the stadium. I wondered who I was going to be with. I hoped it wasn't my neighbor Pamela and her humongous mother Carol. Their a mismatch pair, and it would be hell if I was there with them around. Besides them, they were the only neighbors that sounded like a problem. All I could do now was wait until I was taking to the place.

         It was an hour walk, and I was still being transported. This couldn't be my neighbor if it was taking this long. I wondered how I was ever going to be get out of this. I didn't have my phone with me, and I have no other means of communication. I was totally cut off from my parents. The only idea left was to try and convince my punishment room to help me out once I get there. But it was taking to long to even know if were halfway there. I tried to take a small nap but the guard shook me awake. He forcibly turned my head up, showing me a tiny hole filled with light. We finally made it.
         Without any time to think, the ant pushed me up toward the hole. My body wasn't able to fit through, but he kept pushing. My body was aching in pain,where my arms caught trap between the hole. He kept pushing, scraping my limbs from the side. With a mighty push, I finally went through, and I looked to see that the hole was sealing up. I look around my surrounding, remembering that I've been inside here before. This belonged to a large Indian family right across my house. It consisted of five little girls and a newborn baby, along with a mother, aunt, and grandma as guardians. I was in the car corner of the living room, seeing some of the girls gathered up and watching television. They were very close, but not responsible to go to. Should I just go get helps from the girls, or find the adults?
112221121112.title: Banished.

1122211211121.content:
After that very long walk, my legs weren't up for another venture to look for the adults. It was in my mind to get help from these girls. They might either help me, or get their mommy to come and kill me, which would lessen the journey of finding an adult. I made no time to waste. I carefully walk myself over to the girls. Their backs were turned against me. They were too focused on what was on the television. I gave a few second thoughts about this, but it was only to get noticed. As I'm inching closer to the bodies, I notice a horrible smell. I didn't know if it was me, or the rumors I heard about Indians having horrible odor. I'm not into stereotypes, but this wasn't helping at all. I back up a lot; enough to get away from the intoxicating smell. Now I was looking at all five girls in a line. Ironically, there were all in order according to their age. From oldest to younger it goes from Reshi(12) to Demi(11) to Shelia(8) to Gina(8) to Mikhail(5). They don't know me that very well since I don't visit often, so it would be kind of hard for me to get any help from them. As for their personalities go, that is still a huge mystery to me. I don't know who is nice enough to help or evil enough to get me under their feet. This was nothing more than a gamble now; I could either survive this mishap, or go down and forever be a huge stain on this family's carpet. If only I could just go back down that any colony and teach that Joff a lesson.
         I got a little closer back to my previous position, still noticing that funky smell. It was definitely coming from the girls, but I just kept my nose plugged and my mouth shut; hoping that I won't offend these girls if they do offer to help. As I'm close to passing through them, I notice Reshi's long toes that were still unclipped. This wasn't pretty at all, but I don't blame her because of her age. I stood right in between her and Demi, trying to imagine what the outcome would become. I didn't want them to freak out and squish me to a pulp, but I wasn't just going to stand around and be unnoticed forever. It was my time to step out of the shadows and into the holy light.
